instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the crop-type classification performance, and how far can this metric go in terms of accuracy?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the crop-type classification performance in this study is Overall Accuracy. Overall Accuracy is calculated by dividing the number of correctly classified fields by the total number of fields. 

According to the study, the Overall Accuracy achieved for classifying corn and soybean across all Common Land Units (CLU) fields in Champaign County from 2000 to 2015 was 96%. This indicates that the classification model was able to accurately classify the crop types in 96% of the fields.

Furthermore, the study found that by late July of the concurrent year, the Overall Accuracy for classifying corn and soybean reached 95%. This suggests that the classification model was able to provide accurate crop-type information in-season, without the need to wait until after harvest.

Overall, the chosen metric of Overall Accuracy achieved high levels of accuracy in classifying crop types in the study area.
